intro.title: Welcome
intro.content: Find out how to demonstrate your eligibility to tender

content.value: Which arrangement covers you in respect of building work?

options.label: I'm covered by one enterprise agreement
I'm covered by multiple enterprise agreements
I'm covered by a modern award or other lawful arrangement (e.g. a common law contract)

content.value: Was the enterprise agreement made* on or after 25 April 2014?
content.infoText: *Made – under section 182 of the Fair Work Act 2009, a single enterprise agreement is made when the majority of employees covered by the agreement cast a valid vote to approve the agreement. For greenfields agreements, the relevant date would be the date that the agreement was signed by the parties. The date on which an agreement is made is separate from the date on which the Fair Work Commission approves the agreement.

options.label: Yes, it was made on or after 25 April 2014
No, it was made before 25 April 2014

content.value: Were any of the enterprise agreements made* on or after 25 April 2014?
content.infoText: *Made – under section 182 of the Fair Work Act 2009, a single enterprise agreement is made when the majority of employees covered by the agreement cast a valid vote to approve the agreement. For greenfields agreements, the relevant date would be the date that the agreement was signed by the parties. The date on which an agreement is made is separate from the date on which the Fair Work Commission approves the agreement.

options.label: Yes, one or more of them were made on or after 25 April 2014
No, they were all made before 25 April 2014

content.value: Has it been varied* (in accordance with section 207 of the Fair Work Act 2009) on or after 25 April 2014?
content.infoText: *Varied – A letter of compliance will not be issued until the variation to the agreement has been approved by the Fair Work Commission. A variation of an enterprise agreement operates from the day specified in the Fair Work Commission decision to approve the variation. Up to that time, the earlier agreement continues to cover the entity.

options.label: Yes
No

content.value: Were any of the these enterprise agreements made on or after 2 December 2016?

options.label: Yes, at least one of them was made on or after 2 December 2016
No, they were all made before 2 December 2016

content.value: Have any of these enterprise agreements been varied* (in accordance with section 207 of the Fair Work Act 2009) on or after 25 April 2014?
content.infoText: *Varied – A letter of compliance will not be issued until the variation to the agreement has been approved by the Fair Work Commission. A variation of an enterprise agreement operates from the day specified in the Fair Work Commission decision to approve the variation. Up to that time, the earlier agreement continues to cover the entity.

options.label: Yes
No

content.value: You are eligible to express interest in, tender for and be awarded Commonwealth funded building work
content.infoText:
How to demonstrate your eligibility

Use Self-Declaration A to express interest in, tender for and be awarded Commonwealth funded building work at any time. 

Download Self Declaration A

content.value: You are eligible to express interest in, tender for and be awarded Commonwealth funded building work
content.infoText:
How to demonstrate your eligibility

Use Self-Declaration A to express interest in, tender for and be awarded Commonwealth funded building work at any time. 

Download Self Declaration A

content.value: You will need an ABCC letter of compliance unless an exemption applies to you.
content.preOptionText: The next steps will determine whether you are eligible for an exemption.

options.label: Check whether an exemption applies to you

content.value: Was the enterprise agreement made on or after 2 December 2016?

options.label: Yes, it was made on or after 2 December 2016
No, it was made before 2 December 2016

content.value: You are not eligible for an exemption
content.infoText:
To express interest in and tender for Commonwealth funded building work, you will need a letter of compliance for any enterprise agreement made on or after 2 December 2016.

Find out how to obtain a letter of compliance

content.value: I submitted an expression of interest or tender for Commonwealth funded building work ...

options.label: Before 2 December 2016 (and the relevant enterprise agreement will only apply to that work)
Between 2 December 2016 and 16 February 2017
After 16 February 2017

content.value: You are eligible for an exemption
content.infoText:
Whether or not the enterprise agreement is compliant does not affect your eligibility to express interest in, tender for and be awarded Commonwealth funded building work.

When expressing interest in or tendering for Commonwealth funded building work, contractors need to complete a Declaration of Compliance that lists all enterprise agreements made on or after 25 April 2014 that cover them or their related entities.

You should note you are covered by this exemption when listing this enterprise agreement on your Declaration of Compliance.

content.value: You are eligible for an exemption
content.infoText:
An exemption applies if you expressed interest in or tendered for the work between 2 December 2016 and 16 February 2017. You are eligible to be awarded the contract for this work before 29 November 2018 even if the enterprise agreement that will cover you in respect of the work is not compliant. 

Self-Declaration C can be used for work for which you expressed interest or tendered between 2 December 2016 and 16 February 2017.

Self-Declaration C will demonstrate your eligibility to be awarded that Commonwealth funded building work before 29 November 2018.

content.value: You are not eligible for an exemption
content.infoText:
To be eligible to express interest in, tender for and be awarded Commonwealth funded building work, the enterprise agreement that covers you and your related entities must meet the requirements of section 11 of the Building Code 2016. You will need a letter of compliance.

Find out how to obtain a letter of compliance

content.value: To express interest in and tender for Commonwealth funded building work, you will need a letter of compliance for any enterprise agreement made on or after 2 December 2016.
content.preOptionText:
Find out how to obtain a letter of compliance

Note: if you are also covered by any enterprise agreements made on or after 25 April 2014 but before 2 December 2016, you will also require a letter of compliance unless you are eligible for an exemption. 

If this applies to you, click the button below to check if you are eligible for an exemption.

options.label: I'm also covered by an enterprise agreement made on or after 25 April 2014 but before 2 December 2016.

content.value: You will need an ABCC letter of compliance unless an exemption applies to you

options.label: Check whether an exemption applies to you

content.value: I submitted an expression of interest or tender for Commonwealth funded building work ...

options.label: Before 2 December 2016 (and the relevant enterprise agreement(s) will only apply to that work)
Between 2 December 2016 and 16 February 2017
After 16 February 2017

content.value: You are eligible for an exemption
content.infoText:
Whether or not the enterprise agreement(s) are compliant does not affect your eligibility to express interest in, tender for and be awarded Commonwealth funded building work.

When expressing interest in or tendering for Commonwealth funded building work, contractors need to complete a Declaration of Compliance that lists all enterprise agreements made on or after 25 April 2014 that cover them or their related entities. 

You should note you are covered by this exemption when listing the enterprise agreement(s) on your Declaration of Compliance.

content.value: You are eligible for an exemption
content.infoText:
An exemption applies if you expressed interest in or tendered for the work between 2 December 2016 and 16 February 2017. You are eligible to be awarded the contract for this work before 29 November 2018 even if the enterprise agreement(s) that will cover you in respect of the work is not compliant. 

Self-Declaration C can be used for work for which you expressed interest or tendered between 2 December 2016 and 16 February 2017.

Self-Declaration C will demonstrate your eligibility to be awarded that Commonwealth funded building work before 29 November 2018.

content.value: You are not eligible for an exemption
content.infoText:
To be eligible to express interest in, tender for and be awarded Commonwealth funded building work, the enterprise agreement(s) that cover you and your related entities must meet the requirements of section 11 of the Building Code 2016. You will need a letter of compliance.

Find out how to obtain a letter of compliance
